skill.name: canonical-format-checker
skill.description: This skill should be used when content teaches patterns (skills, subagents, ADRs, PHRs, specifications) that have canonical sources elsewhere. Prevents format drift by ensuring content references and follows the authoritative format from canonical sources. Use before implementing lessons that teach platform patterns, or when reviewing content for format consistency.

security_audit.summary: Pure documentation skill containing only SKILL.md. No executable code, scripts, network operations, or filesystem access beyond its own file. This is a prompt-based guidance document with zero security risk.

content.value_statement: Educational content often drifts from canonical patterns over time. This skill compares lesson content against authoritative sources to ensure students learn correct formats that match platform conventions.
actual_capabilities: Identifies when lessons teach platform patterns like skills, subagents, ADRs, PHRs, or specifications
Locates canonical source examples from existing .claude/ directory structures
Compares lesson content against authoritative format requirements
Detects format drift with specific line-by-line correction instructions
Verifies YAML frontmatter structure and required fields
Confirms directory vs flat file patterns match canonical sources
limitations: Does not modify files automatically - only reports drift
Requires user to provide content location for comparison
Cannot validate code functionality or execution correctness
Limited to patterns defined in the .claude/ directory structure

use_cases.title: Validate lesson format accuracy
use_cases.description: Ensure educational materials teach correct SKILL.md structure and YAML frontmatter patterns.

use_cases.title: Prevent format drift
use_cases.description: Check new documentation against canonical sources before publication to catch inconsistencies.

use_cases.title: Cross-reference patterns
use_cases.description: Verify chapters reference consistent formats across the curriculum to avoid student confusion.

prompt_templates.title: Check skill format
prompt_templates.prompt: Use canonical-format-checker to verify my lesson on creating skills matches the canonical SKILL.md format in .claude/skills/.

prompt_templates.title: Verify ADR format
prompt_templates.prompt: Check if my ADR documentation follows the canonical format from specs/*/adrs/adr-*.md files.

prompt_templates.title: Compare command format
prompt_templates.prompt: Verify my command documentation matches the canonical structure from .claude/commands/*.md files.

prompt_templates.title: Full format audit
prompt_templates.prompt: Run a complete format audit across all chapters to detect any format drift from canonical sources.

output_examples.input: Check my lesson on creating skills against the canonical format
output: Issue: Shows flat file .claude/skills/my-skill.md instead of directory structure
Fix required at lines 45, 52, 60 - change flat file to directory structure with uppercase SKILL.md

best_practices: Always read the canonical source file directly before comparing - do not rely on memory
Report specific line numbers and exact corrections rather than vague format complaints
Check format drift during lesson planning phase before implementation begins
Cross-reference multiple chapters to ensure consistent pattern teaching
anti_patterns: Teaching flat file structure when canonical uses directory structure
Skipping canonical source lookup and relying on assumptions
Providing vague feedback like 'fix the format' without specific line corrections
Inventing new formats instead of following existing canonical patterns

faq.question: What patterns does this skill check?
faq.answer: It checks skills, subagents, ADRs, PHRs, specifications, and commands based on canonical sources in .claude/ directories.

faq.question: Does this skill modify files automatically?
faq.answer: No, it only reports format drift with specific corrections needed. Users must apply fixes manually.

faq.question: Can I use this for non-Claude patterns?
faq.answer: Currently designed for Claude Code platform patterns. Extending to other patterns requires updating the canonical source lookup table.

faq.question: Is my data safe when using this skill?
faq.answer: Yes. This is a pure prompt-based skill with no code execution, network access, or file writing capabilities.

faq.question: What if no canonical source exists for a pattern?
faq.answer: The skill cannot validate unknown patterns. Establish a canonical source first by creating the pattern in .claude/ directory.

faq.question: How is this different from a linter?
faq.answer: Unlike programmatic linters, this skill compares against actual canonical examples to catch semantic drift in teaching materials.
